doc:
Erika Christensen https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erika_Christensen 0 Erika Jane Christensen (born August 19, 1982) is an American actress and singer whose filmography includes roles in Traffic (2000), Swimfan (2002), The Banger Sisters (2002), The Perfect Score (2004), Flightplan (2005), How to Rob a Bank (2007), The Tortured (2010), and The Case for Christ (2017). For her performance in Traffic, she won the MTV Movie Award for Breakthrough Female Performance and the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture along with her co-stars. In 2006, she starred on the short-lived drama series Six Degrees on ABC. From 2010 until its ending in 2015, Christensen starred as Julia Braverman-Graham on the NBC family drama series Parenthood. In 2014, she won a Gracie Award for her performance in the role. Christensen portrayed Betty Beaumontaine on ABC's short-lived crime drama series Wicked City. Erika_Jane_Christensen ( born August_19_,_1982 ) is an_American_actress_and_singer whose_filmography includes roles in Traffic ( 2000 ) , Swimfan ( 2002 ) , The_Banger_Sisters ( 2002 ) , The_Perfect_Score ( 2004 ) , Flightplan ( 2005 ) , How to Rob a_Bank ( 2007 ) , The_Tortured ( 2010 ) , and The_Case for Christ ( 2017 ) . For her_performance in Traffic , she won the_MTV_Movie_Award for Breakthrough_Female_Performance and the_Screen_Actors_Guild_Award for Outstanding_Performance by a Cast in a_Motion_Picture along with her_co-stars . In 2006 , she starred on the_short-lived_drama_series Six_Degrees on ABC . From 2010 until its_ending in 2015 , Christensen starred as Julia_Braverman-Graham on the_NBC_family_drama_series_Parenthood . In 2014 , she won a_Gracie_Award for her_performance in the_role . Christensen portrayed Betty_Beaumontaine on ABC 's_short-lived_crime_drama_series_Wicked_City .
